author: Michael Pachter

author: Michael Pachter

Given weak November NPD sales and Electronic Arts' and Activision's recent earnings warnings, we believe that Take-Two likely experienced weak sales during the holiday period, as consumers continue to shun current generation games while waiting for next generation consoles.

author: Michael Pachter
quote: After April, we expect monthly next generation software sales to remain fairly stable at around $100 - 150 million through October (representing year-over-year growth of $80 - 130 million), with declines of current generation software sales expected to remain at around $130 - 150 million monthly. We expect relatively flat sales through the summer months, with potentially robust sales in November and December, once next generation consoles from Sony and Nintendo are launched.

author: Michael Pachter

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Modern man likes to pretend that his thinking is wide-awake. But this wide-awake thinking has led us into the mazes of a nightmare in which the torture chambers are endlessly repeated in the mirrors of reason.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Writers, you know, are the beggars of Western society.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Deserve your dream.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Love is an attempt at penetrating another being, but it can only succeed if the surrender is mutual.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Solitude is the profoundest fact of the human condition. Man is the only being who knows he is alone.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Technology is not an image of the world but a way of operating on reality. The nihilism of technology lies not only in the fact that it is the most perfect expression of the will to power... but also in the fact that it lacks meaning.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Man, even man debased by the neocapitalism and pseudosocialism of our time, is a marvelous being because he sometimes speaks. Language is the mark, the sign, not of his fall but of his original innocence. Through the Word we may regain the lost kingdom and recover powers we possessed in the far-distant past.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Today we all speak, if not the same tongue, the same universal language. There is no one center, and time has lost its former coherence: East and West, yesterday and tomorrow exist as a confused jumble in each one of us. Different times and different spaces are combined in a here and now that is everywhere at once.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: The electoral process of July 6 perhaps represents a new era in the history of Mexico.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Literature is the expression of a feeling of deprivation, a recourse against a sense of something missing. But the contrary is also true: language is what makes us human. It is a recourse against the meaningless noise and silence of nature and history.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: If we are a metaphor of the universe, the human couple is the metaphor par excellence, the point of intersection of all forces and the seed of all forms. The couple is time recaptured, the return to the time before time.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Social criticism begins with grammar and the re-establishing of meanings.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: A glass pitcher, a wicker basket, a tunic of coarse cotton cloth. Their beauty is inseparable from their function. Handicrafts belong to a world existing before the separation of the useful and the beautiful.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: The North American system only wants to consider the positive aspects of reality. Men and women are subjected from childhood to an inexorable process of adaptation; certain principles, contained in brief formulas are endlessly repeated by the Press, the radio, the churches, and the schools, and by those kindly, sinister beings, the North American mothers and wives. A person imprisoned by these schemes is like a plant in a flowerpot too small for it: he cannot grow or mature.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: To read a poem is to hear it with our eyes; to hear it is to see it with our ears.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Art is an invention of aesthetics, which in turn is an invention of philosophers... What we call art is a game.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: It's always too early to quit.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: If you have zest and enthusiasm you attract zest and enthusiasm. Life does give back in kind.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Your enthusiasm will be infectious, stimulating and attractive to others. They will love you for it. They will go for you and with you.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: If you put off everything till you're sure of it, you'll never get anything done.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Empty pockets never held anyone back. Only empty heads and empty hearts can do that.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: A masterful retreat is itself a victory

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Understanding can overcome any situation, however mysterious or insurmountable it may appear to be.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: The ''how'' thinker gets problems solved effectively because he wastes no time with futile ''ifs.''

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Four things for success: Work and pray, think and believe.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: We struggle with the complexities and avoid the simplicities.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: People become really quite remarkable when they start thinking that they can do things. When they believe in themselves they have the first secret of success.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Don't duck the most difficult problems. That just insures that the hardest part will be left when you're most tired. Get the big one done - it's downhill from then on.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Every problem has in it the seeds of its own solution. If you don't have any problems, you don't get any seeds.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: When a problem comes along, study it until you are completely knowledgeable. Then find that weak spot, break the problem apart, and the rest will be easy.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Become a possibilitarian. No matter how dark things seem to be or actually are, raise your sights and see possibilities -- always see them, for they're always there.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Watch your manner of speech if you wish to develop a peaceful state of mind. Start each day by affirming peaceful, contented and happy attitudes and your days will tend to be pleasant and successful.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Stand up to your obstacles and do something about them. You will find that they haven't half the strength you think they have.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: We've all heard that we have to learn from our mistakes, but I think it's more important to learn from successes. If you learn only from your mistakes, you are inclined to learn only errors.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Anybody can do just about anything with himself that he really wants to and makes up his mind to do. We are capable of greater things than we realize.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Formulate and stamp indelibly on your mind a mental picture of yourself  succeeding. Hold this picture tenaciously. Never permit it to fade. Your mind will seek to develop the picture...Do not build up obstacles in your imagination.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Whenever a negative thought concerning your personal power comes to mind,deliberately voice a positive one to cancel it out.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: It is of practical value to learn to like yourself. Since you must spend so much time with yourself you might as well get some satisfaction out of the relationship.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Know that you yourself are a miracle.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Once we roared like lions for liberty; now we bleat like sheep for security! The solution for America's problem is not in terms of big government, but it is in big men over whom nobody stands in control but God.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: The person who sends out positive thoughts activates the world around him positively and draws back to himself positive results.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Help us to be thankful for this day and every day and treat each one as a preciousgem to be filled to the full with meaning and with love.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Formulate and stamp indelibly on your mind a mental picture of yourself succeeding. Hold this picture tenaciously. Never permit it to fade. Your mind will seek to develop the picture...Do not build up obstacles in your imagination.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Imagination is the true magic carpet.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Throw your heart over the fence and the rest will follow

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Joy increases as you give it, and diminishes as you try to keep it for yourself. In giving it, you will accumulate a deposit of joy greater than you ever believed possible.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Our happiness depends on the habit of mind we cultivate. So practice happy thinking every day. Cultivate the merry heart, develop the happiness habit, and life will become a continual feast.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Lots of people limit their possibilities by giving up easily. Never tell yourself this is too much for me. It's no use. I can't go on. If you do you're licked, and by your own thinking too. Keep believing and keep on keeping on.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: If you paint in your mind a picture of bright and happy expectations, you put yourself into a condition conducive to your goal.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: We tend to get what we expect.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: The life of inner peace, being harmonious and without stress, is the easiest type of existence.

quote: Problems are to the mind what exercise is to the muscles, they toughen and make strong

author: Norman Vincent Peale

author: Norman Vincent Peale

author: Norman Vincent Peale

We are to turn our back upon evil, and in every way possible, do good, help people and bring blessings into their lives.

author: Norman Vincent Peale

author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Don't take tomorrow to bed with you.

The best in the other person begins to flow out toward you as your best flows toward him. In the meeting of the best in each a higher unity of understanding is established.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Any fact facing us is not as important as our attitude toward it, for that determines our success or failure. The way you think about a fact may defeat you before you ever do anything about it. You are overcome by the fact because you think you are.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Any fact facing us is not as important as our attitude toward it, for that determines our success or failure

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: When you pray for anyone you tend to modify your personal attitude toward him.

author: Norman Vincent Peale

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Live your life and forget your age.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Age-based retirement arbitrarily severs productive persons from their livelihood, squanders their talents, scars their health, strains an already overburdened Social Security system, and drives many elderly people into poverty and despair. Ageism is as odious as racism and sexism.

author: Norman Vincent Peale

author: Norman Vincent Peale

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Repetition of the same thought or physical action develops into a habit which, repeated frequently enough, becomes an automatic reflex.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: You will soon break the bow if you keep it always stretched.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
quote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.

author: Bruce Pearl

author: Bruce Pearl

author: Bruce Pearl

author: Bruce Pearl
quote: A big part of March madness is that there are going to be upsets. If Winthrop looks at the No. 2 seeds, they would be thankful they're playing Tennessee instead of some other two-seed.

author: Bruce Pearl
quote: I've worked my whole life to get to a place like Tennessee.

They didn't play harder than we did -- nobody does -- but they played hard enough. I thought they wore us down with their offensive execution.

quote: I'm not at all unhappy with our fans or upset with the students. I shared their enthusiasm. OK, but we did it this one time. Let's not do it again.

author: Bruce Pearl
quote: In the second half, Arkansas clearly was fresher. We did not have the energy to speed things up. We did not turn Arkansas over a lot. It takes energy to create offense or defense, and we needed more energy.

But I understand. I'm numb sitting here myself.

author: Bruce Pearl

author: Bruce Pearl
quote: I think the body of work and the fact that we had such a tough schedule was respected here tonight.

author: Bruce Pearl

author: Bruce Pearl
quote: We are committed to up-tempo basketball. We will press 94 feet. There's a definite advantage because there is a different preparation (for opponents). I think the players do fit our style.

author: Bruce Pearl
quote: We have to focus on getting better down the stretch and playing better basketball. There's no margin for error with this team. When we slip up a little bit, obviously a team like Kentucky is able to expose that.

author: Bruce Pearl
quote: I think that we've got to focus on trying to come down the stretch here and start playing better basketball. When we slip up a little bit, obviously a team like Kentucky is able to expose it.

author: Bruce Pearl

author: Bruce Pearl
quote: This is a real good night for Southeastern Conference basketball. ... When a team like Tennessee can do something to create better balance in the league, we all benefit.

author: Bruce Pearl
quote: It's incredible. To be seeded higher than any team in the history of Tennessee basketball, goes a long way. I'm happy with where we're at. Now we have to take advantage of this opportunity.

author: Bruce Pearl

author: Albert Pike

Only here and there the stout, strong heart and vigorous arms struggle on towards ultimate success.

author: Albert Pike

author: Albert Pike

He did score 69.

author: Luigi Pirandello

author: Luigi Pirandello

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: Whatever is a reality today, whatever you touch and believe in and that seems real for you today, is going to be - like the reality of yesterday - an illusion tomorrow.

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: It is misery, you know, unspeakable misery for the man who lives alone and who detests sordid, casual affairs; not old enough to do without women, but not young enough to be able to go and look for one without shame!

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: You too must not count too much on your reality as you feel it today, since like yesterday, it may prove an illusion for you tomorrow.

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: I would love to spend all my time writing to you; I'd love to share with you all that goes through my mind, all that weighs on my heart, all that gives air to my soul; phantoms of art, dreams that would be so beautiful if they could come true.

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: The history of mankind is the history of ideas.

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: When you say you are in love with humanity, you are well satisfied with yourself.

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: Women are like dreams - they are never the way you would like to have them

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: Nature uses human imagination to lift her work of creation to even higher levels.

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: In bed my real love has always been the sleep that rescued me by allowing me to dream.

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: Life is full of infinite absurdities, which, strangely enough, do not even need to appear plausible, since they are true

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: Drama is action, sir, action and not confounded philosophy.

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: When the characters are really alive before their author, the latter does nothing but follow them in their action, in their words, in the situations which they suggest to him.

author: Jeanine Pirro
quote: The potential for growth is enormous.

author: Robert Pirsig
quote: It is a puzzling thing. The truth knocks on the door and you say, Go away, I'm looking for the truth, and so it goes away. Puzzling.

author: Robert Pirsig

author: Rick Pitino

author: Rick Pitino
quote: I was hoping they wouldn't have that type of game they had (Wednesday). I was hoping they'd save that for us. We're probably going to see a different Syracuse team against us because they have great pride. They need the game and we need the game.

author: Rick Pitino

author: Rick Pitino

author: Rick Pitino

author: Harvey Pitt
quote: This is a significant step in addressing major concerns raised by the investing public in light of recent events. It is more important than ever that decisive action be taken to restore investor confidence to the financial markets, and I commend the leadership shown by the NYSE.

author: Harvey Pitt
quote: This is a significant step in addressing major concerns raised by the investing public in light of recent events, ... It is more important than ever that decisive action be taken to restore investor confidence to the financial markets, and I commend the leadership shown by the NYSE.

author: Harvey Pitt
quote: As a safety precaution while the tragic events of today are sorted out, the securities markets have decided not to open for trading today. We strongly support that decision.

quote: To my mom, any success for me is success for you!

author: Robert Plant

author: Robert Plant
quote: We are trying to communicate a fulfilled ideal. Does anybody remember laughter?

author: Robert Plant

author: William Pollack
quote: Research shows, ... that while mothers tend to soothe their children and shield them from too much stimulation, the average father is inclined to arouse the emotions and stimulate a boy, playing with him zestfully and 'jazzing' him up. â€¦ That roughhousing between father and son that may make mom cringe is actually the rudimentary beginning of a boy's management of his aggression and his ability to substitute emotional mastery and mutual cooperation for violent interaction.

author: William Pollack
quote: There is just one problem here - we're not in a jungle and boys aren't lions.

author: William Pollack
quote: At 5 years old boys feel shamed if they don't push away from mom.

author: William Pollack
quote: Early on, many boys give up. Once they turn it off, they rarely go back to it.

author: William Pollack
quote: There is a crisis in boyhood in America today.

author: William Pollack
quote: Many people, ... base their thinking about boys on the myth that 'testosterone = aggressiveness = boys,' but nothing in the research, mine included, proves that equation to be true . So why do men behave so much more violently than women do, if there is no male 'violence chromosome'? When boys feel disconnected (from adequate love and support) and afraid of being shamed, when they harden themselves and then put on the macho mask, the one emotion they feel it's acceptable to show, and thus the only emotion they will show, is anger.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: At every trifle take offense, that always shows great pride or little sense.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: All looks yellow to a jaundiced eye.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: A little bit of knowledge

author: Alexander Pope
quote: An obstinate person does not hold opinions; they hold them.

author: Alexander Pope

author: Alexander Pope
quote: Teach me to feel another's woe. To hide the fault I see: That the mercy I show to others; that mercy also show to me.

author: Alexander Pope

author: Alexander Pope

author: Alexander Pope
quote: Curse on all laws, but those that love has made.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: It is with our judgments as with our watches: no two go just alike, yet each believes his own.

quote: If, presume not to God to scan; The proper study of Mankind is Man. Plac'd on this isthmus of a middle state, a being darkly wise, and rudely great.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: The ruling passion, be it what it will, The ruling passion conquers reason still

author: Alexander Pope
quote: A brain of feathers, and a heart of lead

author: Alexander Pope
quote: Authors, like coins, grow dear as they grow old: It is the rust we value, not the gold.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: Authors, like coins, grow dear as they grow old:It is the rust we value, not the gold.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: Extremes in nature equal ends produce; In man they join to some mysterious use.

author: Alexander Pope

quote: Gentle dullness ever loves a joke.

quote: The learned is happy, nature to explore; The fool is happy, that he knows no more.

quote: Virtue she finds too painful an endeavour, content to dwell in decencies for ever.

quote: Order is heaven's first law.

author: Alexander Pope
